boat.construction_details: glued clinker, ply with mahogany sheerstrake and fit out. Spruce spars.
boat.full_description:
The Morbic 12 is a 12 foot dinghy designed by French naval architect Francois Vivier with home construction in mind. Its design has echoes of the International 12 foot Olympic class of 1920 combined with the lines of traditional Breton fishing boats.

Aura was a ‘lockdown project’ and is one of over 170 worldwide of which there are more than 18 in the UK. Aura is built from okume marine ply strakes with sapele gunwales and other details. The spars are of sitka spruce with sail by Jeckells of Wroxham.

She has been trailer-sailed around the UK including at: Chichester harbour, reservoirs at Durleigh and Llyn Clywedog, the Rivers Thames, Dart and Beaulieu and the Milford Haven.

Being light, enjoyable and forgiving to sail she has proved popular with enthusiastic and hesitant crews alike.
boat.name: Aura
